summary:
(RAG Format)
This 57-year-old woman, currently on medical leave, presents with intense post-bereavement guilt following the loss of her mother. Despite her relentless involvement in her mother's care, she now blames herself for not doing enough, reactivating a deeply ingrained pattern of hyper-responsibility. Her anger is also directed at the healthcare system, perceived as negligent and abusive, echoing past experiences of domination and control from a previous violent relationship. Chronic mental fatigue and emotional overload are evident, exacerbated by unresolved emotional fusion with her mother and a profound sense of powerlessness.
main_issues: - Institutional anger and distrust towards the medical system
- Emotional overload and chronic mental fatigue
- Reactivation of control and domination trauma from a past abusive relationship
limiting_beliefs: - 'If I don't do everything, others fail or disappear.'
- 'Others are negligent; I'm the only one who can truly care.'
- 'Structures meant to protect become places of danger.'
therapeutic_goals: - Reframe guilt as misplaced responsibility and integrate systemic perspective
- Reduce emotional fusion with the mother and restore personal boundaries
- Dissociate anger from self-blame and externalize it safely
- Anchor self-compassion without sacrificing personal needs
- Reinforce a sense of inner safety despite institutional failures

immediate: - Guided breathing with visualization of the mother in a safe, peaceful place
- Directed cathartic writing: 'Letter to my mother' expressing unspoken emotions
- 'I am not guilty of...' exercise: objective reframing of actions and responsibilities
intermediate: - Progressive work on dismantling sacrificial beliefs ('I must do it all to be loved')
- 'Acts of presence' journal: documenting all actions taken for her mother to counter self-blame
- Emotional body scan practice to detect emotional overload signals
long_term: - Hypnosis theme: Releasing Guilt and Reconnecting with Inner Peace
- Reintegrating the mother as a peaceful, comforting presence
- Anchoring a sense of internal calm, away from sacrificial patterns

motivational_closure: You were there until the very endâ€”more than most people would have been. It's not the fault of a loving daughter if a system fails. Now, it's time to give yourself what you never dared to ask for: peace.
